Description: Hole mouth jar of marl clay pottery with flat base, sides expanding to rounded shoulder, simple rim. Exterior is decorated in red paint with irregular checker-board design, partially obscured by a white deposit. Two small pierced holes on opposite sides near rim were made before firing.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D29C in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Acquisition name: Purchased from: R J Moss & Co
